001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.OutputStream;
005import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
006
007import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheConfig;
008import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheFlags;
009import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheType;
010
011/**
012 * A JStachio Template is a renderer that has template meta data.
013 * <p>
014 * Generated code implements this interface.
015 * <p>
016 * While many of the methods allow passing in custom Escapers care must be taken to choose
017 * a proper escaper that supports the original media type and charset of the template.
018 * There is currently no runtime checking that the escaper supports the template's media
019 * type and charset.
020 *
021 * @author agentgt
022 * @param <T> the model type
023 */
024public interface Template<T> extends Renderer<T>, TemplateInfo {
025
026        /**
027         * Renders the passed in model to an appendable like output.
028         * @param <A> output type
029         * @param <E> error type
030         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
031         * @param appendable the appendable to write to.
032         * @throws E if there is an error writing to the output
033         * @apiNote if the eventual output is to be bytes use
034         * {@link #write(Object, io.jstach.jstachio.Output.EncodedOutput)} as it will leverage
035         * pre-encoding if the template has it.
036         */
037        public <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> A execute(T model, A appendable) throws E;
038
039        /**
040         * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream possibly leveraging
041         * pre-encoded parts of the template.
042         * @param <A> output type
043         * @param <E> error type
044         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
045         * @param output to write to.
046         * @return the passed in output for convenience
047         * @throws E if an error occurs while writing to output
048         * @apiNote for performance and code generation reasons templates do not do validation
049         * that the encoded output has the correct charset.
050         */
051        default <A extends io.jstach.jstachio.Output.EncodedOutput<E>, E extends Exception> A write( //
052                        T model, //
053                        A output) throws E {
054                return execute(model, output);
055        }
056
057        /**
058         * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream using the
059         * {@link #templateCharset()} for encoding. If the template is pre-encoded the
060         * pre-encoded parts of the template will be written to the stream for performance
061         * otherwise an {@link OutputStreamWriter} will wrap the outputstream.
062         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
063         * @param outputStream to write to.
064         * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the outputStream
065         * @apiNote The stream will not be closed but might be flushed by this call.
066         * @see EncodedTemplate
067         */
068        default void write(T model, //
069                        OutputStream outputStream) throws IOException {
070                OutputStreamWriter ow = new OutputStreamWriter(outputStream, templateCharset());
071                execute(model, ow);
072                ow.flush();
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Creates a template model pair.
077         * @param model never <code>null</code> model.
078         * @return executable template model pair.
079         */
080        default TemplateModel model(T model) {
081                return TemplateModel.of(this, model);
082        }
083
084        /**
085         * <strong>EXPERIMENTAL</strong> support of pre-encoded templates that have the static
086         * parts of the template already encoded into bytes. By default all
087         * {@link JStacheType#JSTACHIO} templates that are generated are of this type. To
088         * disable see {@link JStacheFlags.Flag#PRE_ENCODE_DISABLE}.
089         * <p>
090         * This interface is to support
091         * <a href="https://github.com/fizzed/rocker#near-zero-copy-rendering"> Rocker style
092         * near zero-copy rendering</a> where the static template parts are stored as byte
093         * arrays.
094         * <p>
095         * The passed in {@link OutputStream} <em>will only have
096         * {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])} called</em> thus an array or list of byte arrays
097         * can be accumulated to support almost zero-copy. <strong> Consequently absolutely no
098         * mutation of the byte arrays should happen as they could be reusable static parts of
099         * the template! </strong>
100         * <p>
101         * <em>Overall it is recommended that you do not use this interface unless you have an
102         * intimate knowledge of how your platform buffers data and have byte like access as
103         * current JMH benchmarking indicates that
104         * {@link String#getBytes(java.nio.charset.Charset)} is generally much faster for raw
105         * byte conversion albeit at the possible cost of increased memory. One should peform
106         * their own benchmarking to confirm using this interface is worth it. </em>
107         *
108         * @author agentgt
109         * @param <T> the model type
110         * @apiNote The passed in {@link OutputStream} <em>will only have
111         * {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])} called</em> and no mutation of the passed in
112         * byte array should happen downstream.
113         * @see JStacheFlags.Flag#PRE_ENCODE_DISABLE
114         */
115        public interface EncodedTemplate<T> extends Template<T> {
116
117                /**
118                 * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream leveraging pre-encoded
119                 * parts of the template. This <em>may</em> improve performance when rendering
120                 * UTF-8 to an OutputStream as some of the encoding is done in advance. Because
121                 * the encoding is done statically you cannot pass the charset in. The chosen
122                 * charset comes from {@link JStacheConfig#charset()}.
123                 * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
124                 * @param outputStream to write to.
125                 * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the outputStream
126                 * @apiNote The stream will not be closed or flushed by this call.
127                 */
128                @Override
129                default void write(T model, //
130                                OutputStream outputStream) throws IOException {
131                        write(model, Output.of(outputStream, templateCharset()));
132                }
133
134                /**
135                 * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream leveraging pre-encoded
136                 * parts of the template. This <em>may</em> improve performance when rendering
137                 * UTF-8 to an OutputStream as some of the encoding is done in advance. Because
138                 * the encoding is done statically you cannot pass the charset in. The chosen
139                 * charset comes from {@link JStacheConfig#charset()}.
140                 * @param <A> output type
141                 * @param <E> error type
142                 * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
143                 * @param output to write to.
144                 * @return the passed in output for convenience
145                 * @throws E if an error occurs while writing to output
146                 */
147                public <A extends io.jstach.jstachio.Output.EncodedOutput<E>, E extends Exception> A write( //
148                                T model, //
149                                A output) throws E;
150
151                @Override
152                default TemplateModel model(T model) {
153                        return TemplateModel.of(this, model);
154                }
155
156        }
157
158}
